docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11.--In a formal statement issued here today through official channels the assertion is made by Dr. Cecilio Baez, former President of Paraguay and Paraguayan Minister in Washington, that Germany was on the point of provoking a war...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 11.--In a formal statement issued here today through official channels the assertion is made by Dr. Cecilio Baez, former President of Paraguay and Paraguayan Minister in Washington, that Germany was on the point of provoking a war of conquest in Latin America " in order to be better prepared to fight the United States and England."
docs.abstract: welcomes U. S. protection against attack on Latin Amer.

headline.main: SAYS BERLIN PLANNED WAR ON LATIN AMERICA; Paraguayan Minister Welcomes Our Protection Against European Marauding Powers.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 13.--The United States Government is prepared to exert every influence to stop exports from South America to neutral nations of Europe which might supply fats, munitions, and other commodities to Germany.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 13.--The United States Government is prepared to exert every influence to stop exports from South America to neutral nations of Europe which might supply fats, munitions, and other commodities to Germany.

headline.main: PLANS NEW CHECK ON AID TO GENMANY; United States Will Now Cut Off All Teuton Imports from South America. COAL SUPPLY ONE WEAPON German Concerns in Southern Republics Will Be Barred from Continued Help in Operating PLANS NEW CHECK ON AID TO GERMANY

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 25.--The Chamber of Deputies today voted in favor of a rupture with Germany. The vote was 53 to 18.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 25.--The Chamber of Deputies today voted in favor of a rupture with Germany. The vote was 53 to 18.

headline.main: VOTE FOR BREAK WITH GERMANY; Argentine Deputies, by 53 to 18, Sustain Move Which Senate Had Taken. URUGUAY FAVORS RUPTURE Calls Congress to Take Action Saturday--Paraguay Also Expected to Act.

headline.main: VON LUXBURG FLEES ON SPANISH STEAMER; German Minister Leaves Argentina Under Police Escort andSails From Montevideo.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 7.-- Uruguay has severed diplomatic relations with Germany. A Presidential decree announced the rupture, following a vote in favor of it by the Chamber of Deputies, 74 to 23. Passports have been sent to the German Minister.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 7.-- Uruguay has severed diplomatic relations with Germany. A Presidential decree announced the rupture, following a vote in favor of it by the Chamber of Deputies, 74 to 23. Passports have been sent to the German Minister.
docs.abstract: Govt. severs diplomatic relations with Germany; Pres. Viera says Govt. must espouse cause of democracy

headline.main: URUGUAY BREAKS WITH GERMANY ON GROUND OF HONOR; Rupture Announced Officially After Deputies Vote For It, 74 to 23. CHAMPIONS SMALL NATIONS President Viera Declares It Necessary to Defend the Cause of Justice. PERU CALLS BACK MINISTER Fifteen Countries Have Followed Our Lead in Severing Diplomatic Relations. HOSTILITY TO BERLIN GROWS. Argentina Expected to Follow Uruguay in Breaking Relations. PERU RECALLS HER MINISTER. Also Orders Withdrawal of All Consuls from Germany.
